name: Island of Rare Animals
description: An undeveloped, forest-covered island in the East Blue known for its distinctive hybrid wildlife that combines traits of two different species. The island features a prominent tall butte with five empty treasure chests at its summit, which became the focus of Gaimon's twenty-year guardianship.
notableFeatures: Five treasure chests positioned at the summit (all empty)
Dense forest vegetation covering most of the island
Home to exotic hybrid animal species
Isolated location between other East Blue islands

keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates discover and arrive at the Island of Rare Animals, seeking the legendary treasure rumored to be hidden there.
The crew encounters the island's unique hybrid animal inhabitants for the first time.
Gaimon reveals himself as the self-appointed guardian of the island and its treasures.
Luffy climbs the island's tall butte and discovers that all five treasure chests at the summit are empty.
The Straw Hat Pirates depart from the island, leaving Gaimon behind as guardian of the rare animals.

historicalSignificance: The Island of Rare Animals serves as an important thematic location in One Piece, representing the idea that true treasure isn't material wealth but the bonds and purpose we find in life. Gaimon's twenty-year residence and transformation from greedy pirate to peaceful guardian embodies this theme. The island is also notable for being one of the shortest canonical stays for the Straw Hat Pirates, lasting only one chapter in the manga.
terrain: Forested island with prominent vertical rock formations

geography.position: Between the Gecko Islands and Baratie (anime) or between Organ Islands and Gecko Islands (manga)

trivia: The Straw Hat Pirates spent the shortest canonical time on this island compared to most locations - just one manga chapter and anime episode.
The island's unique hybrid animals are highly sought after by poachers due to their rarity.
The five treasure chests atop the butte were empty, though it's never revealed who placed them there or why.
The island's name influenced the title of the third One Piece film, though that movie featured a different island (O-Kan Island).
In cover stories, Gaimon is later joined by Sarfunkel, a woman trapped in a barrel, and they continue living happily on the island together.

name: Going Merry
description: The Straw Hat Pirates' first ship, a caravel gifted to them by Kaya. In this episode, the crew works on designing their Jolly Roger flag to mark their identity as a pirate crew.
notableFeatures: Caravel-class ship with a sheep figurehead
Canvas sails ready for the Jolly Roger painting

keyEvents.description: Luffy and Usopp design and paint the Straw Hat Pirates' Jolly Roger flag aboard the Going Merry.

historicalSignificance: The Going Merry serves as the Straw Hat Pirates' home and transportation. The creation of their Jolly Roger on the ship marks an important step in establishing their crew identity.
trivia: The Jolly Roger design scene in this episode is anime-original; in the manga, the flag is designed and painted on the ship later in Chapter 43.
